title: Konjuh (mountain)
text:
Konjuh is a mountain in north-east part of <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>. Mountain is bordered by rivers of Seona, Turija, Litva, and Oskova on the north, river Gostelja and highway <a href="Tuzla">Tuzla</a>–<a href="Sarajevo">Sarajevo</a> on north-east, and river <a href="Krivaja%20%28Bosna%29">Krivaja</a> on south and west. With <a href="Ozren%20%28Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%29">Ozren</a>, <a href="Javor%20%28Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%29">Javor</a> and <a href="Javornik%20%28Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%29">Javornik</a>, Konjuh makes part of mountain chain which with <a href="Trebavac">Trebavac</a> and <a href="Majevica">Majevica</a> present transition of <a href="Dinaridi">Dinaric</a> mountain system to the spacious <a href="Panonian%20plain">Panonian plain</a>.
Average height of this mountain is 1000 meters. Above this height there are tops: Šuplji Javor (1157 m), Vina Kruška (1088 m), Suho Drvlje (1206 m), Zidine (1180m), Brezina (1120 m), Vrh Konjuha (1328 m) and Bandijerka, top of Javorje (1261 m), Bijeli Vrh (1272 m) and Zečiji Rat (1275 m) on southwestern comb Smolin.
Flora and fauna.
Konjuh is covered with dense vegetation in conifer which prevails (<a href="pine">pine</a> and <a href="spruce">spruce</a>), <a href="beech">beech</a>, <a href="maple">maple</a> and in a small number <a href="oak">oak</a>. On the mountain also grows very rare and curative <a href="lincura">lincura</a> – srčanik ("Gentiana lutea"), which is on this mountain protected and endangered.
In the woods of Konjuh there are wild animals like: <a href="brown%20bear">brown bear</a>, <a href="roe%20deer">roe deer</a>, <a href="wild%20boar">wild boar</a>, <a href="wolf">wolf</a>, <a href="fox">fox</a>, <a href="squirrel">squirrel</a>, <a href="grouse">grouse</a>, and in the streams and rivers <a href="trout">trout</a> and <a href="crayfish">crayfish</a>. Snakes that live here are <a href="Vipera%20ammodytes">horned viper</a>, <a href="common%20viper">common viper</a>, <a href="Agkistrodon%20contortrix">copperhead</a>, and also <a href="lizard">lizard</a>, <a href="green%20lizard">green lizard</a> and <a href="salamander">salamander</a>.
Cultural and historical monuments.
On the mountain of Konjuh there are many necropolises "<a href="ste%C4%87ak">stećak</a>s", and only in the municipality of <a href="Kladanj">Kladanj</a> 500 stećaks are known. There are also ruins of caravan road which is used for transport of salt from <a href="Tuzla">Tuzla</a>, as well as monuments from <a href="World%20War%20II%20in%20Yugoslavia">World War II in Yugoslavia</a>.
Mountain protection.
Hiking associations and nature lovers are trying for years to convince authorities that part of the mountain call a protected natural zone. Government of <a href="Tuzla%20Canton">Tuzla Canton</a> submitted a Law for declaring parts of the mountain Konjuh a protected natural zone.
